ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then He revealed to His slave what He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When He revealed to His votary what He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Then he revealed to Allah's servant whatever he had to reveal.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He revealed to God's servant whatever he wanted.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So Allah divinely revealed to His bondman, whatever He divinely revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So (Allah) revealed to His servant whatever He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And He revealed to His servant what He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then revealed to his servant that he revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and revealed to God's servant what he revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Thus He revealed Unto His bondman whatsoever He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: whereat He revealed to His servant whatever He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So did (Allah) convey the inspiration to His Servant- (conveyed) what He (meant) to convey.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So did (Allah) convey the Inspiration to His slave [Muhammad SAW through Jibrael (Gabriel)].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: so (Allah) revealed to His worshiper (Gabriel) that which he revealed (to Prophet Muhammad).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then He revealed to His servant what He revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And he revealed to His Servant what he revealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:10] whereat He, [God] exalted be He, revealed to His servant, Gabriel, what he, Gabriel, revealed, to the Prophet (s); the thing being revealed is not mentioned [explicitly] in exaltation of its [great] status.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And He revealed unto His slave) Gabriel (that which He revealed) to His slave Muhammad (pbuh); and it is said this means: and He revealed to His slave Muhammad (pbuh) that which He revealed.
